USYD IOT PROJECT OVERVIEW


Project Managers

Prof.Branka Vucetic

  • MSc PhD Belgrade, MIEEE FIEAust MAAEE ARC Laureate Fellow
  • Director of the Telecommunications Laboratory
  • School of Electrical and Information Engineering
  • The University of Sydney


    • Professor Branka Vucetic's work aims to develop theoretical framework and design principles for wireless communication systems. She is an internationally recognised expert in coding theory and its applications in wireless engineering. Professor Vucetic has held various research and academic positions in the UK, Yugoslavia and Australia, and since 1986 she has been with the School of Electrical and Information Engineering at Sydney University, where she is currently Laureate Professor and Director of the Centre of Excellence in Telecommunications.

    Dr.Zihuai Lin

  • Senior Lecturer
  • School of Electrical & Information Engineering
  • The University of Sydney


    • Zihuai Lin (S’98–M’06–SM’10) received the Ph.D. degree in Electrical Engineering from Chalmers University of Technology, Sweden, in 2006. Prior to this, he worked at Ericsson Research, Stockholm, Sweden. Following his Ph.D. graduation, he worked as an Associate Professor at Aalborg University, Denmark. He is currently working at the School of Electrical and Information Engineering at the University of Sydney, Australia. His research interests include source/channel/network coding, coded modulation, MIMO, OFDMA, SC-FDMA, radio resource management, cooperative communications, small-cell networks, 5G cellular systems, see-through wall radar imaging, mm-wave power transfer and others.

    Dr.Ming Ding

  • Senior Research Scientist,Networks Group
  • Cyber Physical Systems Research Program Data61, CSIRO


    • Ming Ding was invited to chair the workshop on 5G heterogeneous and small cell networks (HetSNets) in IEEE Globecom 2017.
    Ming Ding is a senior research scientist at Data61, CSIRO, in Sydney, NSW, Australia. He has authored over 60 papers in IEEE journals and conferences, all in recognized venues, and about 20 3GPP standardization contributions, as well as a Springer book “Multi-point Cooperative Communication Systems: Theory and Applications”. Also, he holds 30 US patents and co-invented another 100+ patents on 4G/5G technologies. He is or has been Guest Editor/Co-Chair/Co-Tutor/TPC member of several IEEE top-tier journals/conferences, e.g., the IEEE Journal on Selected Areas in Communications, the IEEE Communications Magazine, and the IEEE Globecom Workshops, etc. For his inventions and publications, he was the recipient of the President’s Award of Sharp Laboratories of China in 2012, and served as one of the key members in the 4G/5G standardization team when it was awarded in 2014 as Sharp Company Best Team: LTE 2014 Standardization Patent Portfolio.

    Dr.Joe Peng

  • MCU FAE Section Manager at STMicroelectronics. Sydney, Australia


    • 13 years of experience in embedded software/firmware engineering. Specializing in complex embedded software development.
    -Deep knowledge of MCU MPU WIFI Matlab/Simulink
    -Board bring-up and device driver development with C/Assembly.
    -Multi-threads application development with C/C++.
    -GUI development with C/C++, JavaScript / HTML / CSS / Ajax.
    -Configuration / Test / Manufacturing tools design with C/C++, Python.
    - Android video conference app development with Java / Android NDK / OpenGL.
